p: This site offers a WebService to automatically validate your PEPPOL documents.
The WSDL file can be found at http://peppol.helger.com/wsdocumentvalidation?wsdl
This service is currently provided free of charge. If you want to setup your own service for production usage don't hesitate to contact me at philip[at]helger[dot]com for support.
It offers one method called "executeValidationPyramid" that takes the following arguments:

td.p: At the moment no rules for "TENDERING_CATALOGUE" are present.

tr.td:
Depending on the DocumentType parameter, different values are allowed:
For "CATALOGUE" use "T19"
For "ORDER" use "T01"
For "ORDERRESPONSE" use "T02" or "T03"
For "CREDITNOTE" use "T14"
For "INVOICE" use "T10", "T15" or "T17"
The available enumeration of transactions is based on the overall transaction list of the CEN/BII workshop. The other available transactions are currently not in scope of PEPPOL or no validation rules are present.

td.p: This specifies the country who's national rules should be applied. It must be stated in the format ISO-3166 ALPHA 2.
At the moment national rules are available for the following countries:
Passing in any other valid country code will do no harm but has no additional effect.
Not passing a country code has the effect, that
Indicates whether the industry specific validation rules should be applied or not. Industry specific rules can also be rules that are specific for a government.
Industry specific rules are only available if national rules are available. Passing "true" but no country code means, that no industry specific rules are applied.

tr.td: This is the main XML document to be validated. For simplicity it must be provided as an inline string.

td.p: This parameter determines the language in which error codes are returned. The following languages are supported:
If this parameter is not provided "en" is used as the default value.

p: The response of calling this service is a complex structure with the following items:

tr.td: Determines the overall return code. Only if the value is "NO_ERROR" that the remaining parts of the result are defined. Any value different from "NO_ERROR" indicates an error in the input parameters!

td.p: In case the passed UBL document does not match the UBL XML schema, validation is "interrupted" and the remaining Schematron checks are not performed.
If this field is "true" than the Schematron checks where not executed!

tr.td: This field indicates the most severe error that occurred in validation. This field has the sole purpose to easily identify whether a document was totally valid (value "SUCCESS"), whether some warnings but no errors occurred (value "WARN") or whether at least one error occurred (value "ERROR" or "FATAL_ERROR").

td.p: This field is a container for the detailed validation issues. For each warning or error a separate item is created. The order of the list is the order in which validation took place.
If the list may be empty if the MostSevereErrorLevel is "SUCCESS".

p: Each Item in the "Items" list has the following semantics:

tr.td: The validation level in which this error occurred.

td.p: The type of validation applied. Currently supported types are:

tr.td: The error level of this item. See description on "MostSevereErrorLevel" above
Provides a pseudo location where the error occurred. The layout depends on the "ValidationType" parameter.
In case the ValidationType parameter is "SCHEMATRON" this parameter contains the value of the SVRL "test" attribute showing what was tested.
The human readable error text. If possible the text is in the display locale provided by the respective input parameter.
In case an unexpected error occurred in validation, this field contains the respective message. This field is only present for error tracing and should not be presented to the user.
